title: my phone
body:
OK, maybe more aptly titled “why can’t lemonskeleton get a job?” But something is happening to my phone I think... my computer and my phone.

On the brink of a recovery- emotionally, mentally and physically. I’ve been grinding the good old job search… for a good year at least.

It’s not that I am stupid. If anything, I made stupid choices and almost married stupidly. He was an abusive alcoholic, but that’s not who I met (I watched him fall and break his neck it changed his personality. A whole ’nother story for another day.)

But things are happening now that I can’t explain. At first, I’d get the slew of calls upon applying for the wrong job. “Hello, is lemon dere? Ms. Skeleton I received your resume.”

Here are the glitches in the matrix preceding the phone thing:

Thing 1: I go to write this story and my camera/live stream app comes on by itself.

I kill the app and keep writing. Weirder has happened.

But coupled with what happened to my mom, who is the skeptic to end all skeptics, I figured it may be related.

After I pick her up from work two days ago she tells me “it was ze weirdest sing," her thick french accent making every word cute. “I was thinking about your fozzer [father] and my phone starts to call him!”

I needed to understand. It was just a technical fluke. I probed for answers. “Where was your phone? Did you ask Siri?”

The phone called my father’s number right before my mom’s eyes - she wasn’t touching it and didn’t tell Siri/ blueteeth/etc.

So these things are kind of weird but I am pretty logical when I’m not having fun and being conspiratorial. These things in and of themselves would not constitute grounds for nosleep.

As I said before, looking for a job ends up with my information getting sold and me getting at least five calls a day. This last bout of phone calls is different, however.

I ignored a number with an area code I recognized (from my hometown). This is typical of me. For one, I'm still mostly socially dead inside and it takes every ounce of my being to partake in casual social pleasantries.

Immediately following area code call I get a phone call from the opposite coast. Cool - I answer it hoping it’s a hiring recruiter I want to talk to, or a job I actually wanted and to which I submitted.

“Hello?” I sort of asked.

“Hello? Hello?!” the man’s voice sounded far away.
I sat straight up. “Hello?" I answered, trying my best to sound professional. "Can you hear me OK?”

He couldn't hear me. As if no one had answered him at all, I heard him look at the phone, shrug and hang up.

I don’t know how else to explain it.

I know I'm jaded when it comes to telemarketers, but I used to work in a call center. I'm convinced that hell is a call center. Joking aside, I take pity on call reps. Considering the job market I'm not one to be picky right now. I don't waste their time but when it makes sense to try to pursue the contract I do. A lady named Cathy and I spoke for quite a while last week. I wasn’t even sure she was trying to sell me anything. It was Friday and I pushed her off until Monday. Nice lady from my home state, but I could hear she wasn't born there (she was too nice to be born and raised on the east coast.) We talked for a minute on Monday, enough for me to gauge my disinterest. I was done being polite and told her "thanks but... no" to whatever she wanted to talk about. She was so happy to talk to me, as if she hadn't spoken to another person in a long time. It's unusual to hear, especially from a telemarketer. She was elated when I told her to try me back after the weekend.

So happy, in fact, that Cathy tried to call me from four different numbers over the next week, repeatedly. She left me several voicemails. And apparently she is dead.

Upon looking up the first number I learn belonged to a lady who died. Cathy [redacted].

I think the dead are calling my phone.

Not to mention, super recently, more and more, I always feel like something is watching me (rest in peace, MJ.) Obligatory ‘Has this happened to anyone else?’ because I’m honestly sketched out. There is more (regarding my phone) but I don’t know if it’s related…
author: Lemonskeleton
